brief: Helper class for a list of ints

methods.name: size()
methods.desc: Get the length of the list

methods.name: clear()
methods.desc: Remove all entries from the list

methods.name: get()
methods.desc: Get an entry at a particular index

methods.name: set()
methods.desc: Set the entry at a particular index

methods.name: remove()
methods.desc: Remove an element from the specified index

methods.name: append()
methods.desc: Add a new entry to the list

methods.name: hasValue()
methods.desc: Check if a number is a part of the list

methods.name: sort()
methods.desc: Sorts the array, lowest to highest

methods.name: sortReverse()
methods.desc: Reverse sort, orders values from highest to lowest

methods.name: reverse()
methods.desc: Reverse the order of the list elements

methods.name: shuffle()
methods.desc: Randomize the order of the list elements

methods.name: array()
methods.desc: Create a new array with a copy of all the values

description: Helper class for a list of ints. Lists are designed to have some of the features of ArrayLists, but to maintain the simplicity and efficiency of working with arrays. Functions like sort() and shuffle() always act on the list itself. To get a sorted copy, use list.copy().sort().
name: IntList
